headline: Anthropic eases software's AI fears with enterprise partnerships
summary: Anthropic (ANTH.PVT) is showing investors that artificial Intelligence (AI) isn't about replacing software. Yahoo Finance Technology Editor Dan Howley joins Yahoo Finance host Josh Lipton to discuss the company's new partnerships and plugin features that integrate its AI tools with apps like Google's Gmail (GOOG, GOOGL) and Microsoft Excel (MSFT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: 'Boring' energy, consumer staples stocks can buffer tech losses
summary: STORY: Meanwhile, tech stocks have been "a mixed bag," Mussio said, with most falling - including Microsoft, Nvidia, Meta Platforms and Amazon.He added that "it is worth noting" that companies such as Nvidia and Microsoft have market caps bigger than some entire sectors, "like energy, for example.""And so I think it's just a really good reminder for investors to be diversified, not just across asset classes... but within the asset classes," he said, and to have some exposure to the "boring sectors" that offer diversification from Big Tech.

headline: Microsoft’s $83.09 Billion Decision Could Shape What Happens Next
summary: Last quarter, Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) delivered a strong earnings beat, but one number overshadowed everything else: $29.88 billion in capital expenditures (CapEx) for Q2 FY2026, the quarter ended Dec. 31, 2025. That figure, reported in Microsoft’s 8-K filed Jan. 28, 2026, represents a 89% increase year-over-year from $15.80 billion — a near-doubling in a single quarter ... summary: The U.S. Coast Guard Office of Emergency Management and Disaster Response (CG-OEM) has officially selected PRATUS® as its enterprise incident management platform, marking a significant milestone in the Service's Force Design 2028 modernization strategy. Built on Microsoft Azure Government and integrated with Microsoft 365, PRATUS will transform how the Coast Guard coordinates complex emergency operations.

headline: Meta AMD AI Chip Alliance Reshapes Meta Platforms Capital And Compute Story
summary: Meta Platforms (NasdaqGS:META) has entered a multi year AI chip partnership with AMD, centered on AMD Instinct accelerators. The agreement includes more than 6 gigawatts of AI compute capacity and a performance based equity component that could give Meta up to 10% of AMD. The deal focuses on collaboration across next generation silicon, systems, and AI software platforms. Meta Platforms, trading at around $637.25 per share, is moving to broaden its AI infrastructure beyond a single supplier...

headline: Nucleus Research Releases 2026 SFA Technology Value Matrix
summary: In 2026, Sales Force Automation technology is defined by execution, not record keeping. As sales teams are asked to deliver predictable growth with constrained resources, SFA platforms are being evaluated on how directly they improve productivity, forecast accuracy, and deal progression. Core capabilities such as pipeline management and reporting remain foundational, but ROI is increasingly driven by how effectively platforms translate insight into action.

headline: Goldman Team Says Asset-Heavy Stocks Outperform on AI Fears
summary: The Goldman team said their basket of capital intensive stocks whose economic value derives from physical assets has outperformed a capital light group reliant on human or digital capital by about 35% since the start of 2025.  Investors are increasingly turning to stocks with what the strategists called the “HALO effect,” for heavy assets and low obsolescence, in sectors like utilities, basic resources and energy, the team including Guillaume Jaisson said in a client note.

raw.headline: Goldman Team Says Asset-Heavy Stocks Outperform on AI Fears
raw.summary: The Goldman team said their basket of capital intensive stocks whose economic value derives from physical assets has outperformed a capital light group reliant on human or digital capital by about 35% since the start of 2025.  Investors are increasingly turning to stocks with what the strategists called the “HALO effect,” for heavy assets and low obsolescence, in sectors like utilities, basic resources and energy, the team including Guillaume Jaisson said in a client note.

headline: Jana Stake And New CEO Put Fiserv AI Plan In Focus
summary: Jana Partners has taken a stake in Fiserv (NasdaqGS:FISV) and is pressing for changes to the company’s direction and priorities. At the same time, new CEO Mike Lyons is rolling out a One Fiserv plan centered on artificial intelligence and partnerships with firms such as Microsoft and Mastercard. These moves arrive together as the company reassesses how it competes in payments and financial technology. Fiserv sits at the intersection of payments, banking technology and merchant services, an...

headline: Trump Seeks Vows from Tech Executives to Cover Data Center Costs
summary: The effort includes pressing technology executives to sign non-binding compacts vowing that their companies would take on the cost of building the necessary infrastructure to support their data center use, said the people, who requested anonymity to discuss a plan that isn’t yet public.  Officials in President Donald Trump’s administration have been talking with Microsoft Corp., Alphabet Inc. and other companies about signing the pledges, the people said.  White House spokespeople didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment lodged after normal business hours Monday evening.

raw.headline: Trump Seeks Vows from Tech Executives to Cover Data Center Costs
raw.summary: The effort includes pressing technology executives to sign non-binding compacts vowing that their companies would take on the cost of building the necessary infrastructure to support their data center use, said the people, who requested anonymity to discuss a plan that isn’t yet public.  Officials in President Donald Trump’s administration have been talking with Microsoft Corp., Alphabet Inc. and other companies about signing the pledges, the people said.  White House spokespeople didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment lodged after normal business hours Monday evening.

headline: 'Big Short' Investor Michael Burry Draws Parallel Between Nvidia and This 1920s Era Hot Stock: 'You Would Have Lost Money…'
summary: "Big Short" investor Michael Burry warned that the Nvidia-led AI boom could mirror the 1920s radio bubble, cautioning that massive data center spending by Big Tech may strain balance sheets and fail to deliver lasting investor returns despite the technology's long-term promise.

headline: Nebius Tavily Deal Links AI Agents To Growing Cloud Infrastructure
summary: Nebius Group (NasdaqGS:NBIS) has acquired Tavily, a provider of agentic search software for AI agents in financial trading and coding. Nebius is backed by large contracts with major technology firms, including Meta and Microsoft, as it scales its AI cloud platform. headline: Microsoft Ties Xbox Leadership To AI Cloud And Security Ambitions
summary: Microsoft (NasdaqGS:MSFT) announced a leadership transition in its Gaming division, with Xbox chief Phil Spencer retiring and Asha Sharma taking over. Sharma previously led Microsoft’s CoreAI group, bringing an AI focused background into the gaming business. The company also announced expanded partnerships, including work with CrowdStrike on AI driven cybersecurity and with Ericsson on enterprise 5G integration.
